history.content:
Hey everyone!

We've decided to extend the mentor application for CSM 61C until Wednesday August 19, 11:59 PM, so if you didn't get the chance to fill it out and are interested in becoming a mentor, please apply!

Computer Science Mentors lead their students in small-group sections and individualized teaching settings, work with a family of like-minded mentors to improve their own teaching, and gain support from the larger community of students, teachers, and mentors in CSM. You’ll be in a unique position to help your fellow students and stay connected to the course material. The class size in the fall tends to be quite large, and with things being online, students will highly appreciate your guidance as a mentor. Additionally, if you’re thinking about teaching on course staff for 61C or any other course in the future and are looking for teaching experience, becoming a CSM mentor is a great first step!

61C is one of the smaller CSM classes, and our goal is to accept everyone who is genuinely interested in mentoring, so don't stress too much about the application - we'll be assessing applicants mainly off the interview. You can apply here to be a part of CSM Fall 2020: https://tinyurl.com/CSMFa20-Apply

More about CSM: We’re a group of passionate students and mentors who are creating an open and inclusive community for computer science and electrical engineering students to receive individualized academic and social support, and we need your help to make that happen. We are currently recruiting mentors for CS 61A, CS 88, CS 61B, CS 61C, CS 70, EECS 16A and EECS 16B.
history.subject: CSM 61C Still Accepting Applications!
